projects.title: Film-induced Tourism: A qualitative case study on the influence of popular media on tourist motivation to visitation of film destinations
projects.description:
Master's degree dissertation.

The research question of the master's degree dissertation was as follows:
"How may fandom of HBO’s Television series, Game of Thrones, influence the tourist motivation of its fans to visit Game of Thrones film locations in Northern Ireland?"

projects.title: Intercultural Communication at the Workplace: A case study on Abbey Tours and its internal communication
projects.description:
Internship placement project.

The research question to this project was as follows:
"What cultural differences are sources for miscommunication and clashes at Abbey Tours? In addition, which intercultural communication competencies are required to hold by the employees in order to deal with miscommunication and clashes presented by Abbey Tours’ cultural diverse work force?"

projects.title: Cultural Diversity at the Workplace: A comparative analysis of cultural differences and challenges in a multicultural workplace
projects.description:
Bachelor's degree dissertation.

The research questions on the bachelor's degree dissertation are as follows:
"What intercultural communication challenges may arise in an intercultural collaboration between Japanese and Belgians, and which intercultural communication competencies are important to hold or develop in order for such a collaboration to be successful?"

The aim of the project is to examine cultural value differences and uncover potential intercultural communication challenges as well as determine which intercultural communication competencies are important to hold or develop in order for an intercultural collaboration to be successful in relation to a Japanese-Belgian work-related collaboration.
This was done through analyses of transcribed scenes from the film, Fear and Trembling, by applying the Cultural Dimensions Theory and the Behavioural Assessments Scale for Intercultural Competence. In addition, the project tested the applicability of the two frameworks in order to determine whether or not the cultural dimensions of the frameworks are reflected in real life experiences at the workplace – in this case as represented through the film Fear and Trembling.
The analysis revealed that intercultural communication challenges arise due to different cultural values and a lack of mutual understanding and knowledge of foreign culture(s). Thus, intercultural communication challenges arise when interactants in an intercultural collaboration demonstrate interculturally incompetent behaviour. The important intercultural communication competencies that are needed in order for a Japanese-Belgian collaboration to be successful - or any intercultural collaboration - hence, revolve around cultural awareness.

profile_positions.description:
HR Specialist, EMEA:
- The point of contact for operational HR-related matters covering the employee lifecycle, including HR practices, policies, processes, systems and tools as well as creation of employment documentation (e.g. employment contracts, extensions and amendments as well as employment statements and references)
- Anticipating and identifying challenges and developing/improving and implementing solutions to end-to-end HR operations processes, policies, programs and workflows aimed at automating these while ensuring they are up-to-date with local changes in legislation
- Understanding of employment laws and regulations 
- Maintaining employee information and records in our HRIS people system  
- Supporting various global HR operations projects (e.g updating of our HRIS, employee knowledge & support Wiki pages, employee handbooks and more)
- First point of contact and support on payroll queries related to payroll submission, including providing documentation for changes to our internal payroll team as well as third party local payroll provider
- Ensure data integrity by way of driving best practices through auditing and reporting
- Assists with recruitment and interview process 
- Management of background checks 
- Relocation for our new colleagues, including immigration
- Internal mobility and inter-company transfers
- Manage the on-boarding and off-boarding process, including new hire orientation and training logistics, coordination of the exit processes as well as management of employee benefits 
- Management of leaves, including parental and sick leave
- Team support for OKR quarterly goal-setting
- Quarterly talent reviews
- Performance Improvement Plans
- Build effective relationships with employees at all levels, including external partners 

- Programs: Namely, iSolved, PeopleDoc, SmartRecruiters, Jobvite, BetterWorks, HireRight, 2Secure, eTrade, CultureAmp, ArboNed, Microsoft Office, G Suite, JIRA, AMEX Travel, Airbnb for Companies, Slack, Teams

profile_positions.description:
Being a Problem Based Learning Student at AAU means that, each semester, students work closely together in groups with fellow students (often also companies) for app. 2-4 months in an international environment on a large scale project related to their studies. It is their full responsibility to produce the project only supervised by a professor. It is their assignment to formulate a problem that they, though theories, methods and data collection relevant to their studies, can answer. As such, the problem forms the basis of the project and gives the students an opportunity to put theoretical knowledge into practice in cooperation with research participants and companies. 

Problem Based Learning Student:
- Project organisation, coordination and management
- Problem identification, formulating and solving
- Schedule group (and company) meetings
- Write notes to group members concerning discussions on meetings
- Delegate tasks and assignments
- Set and make deadlines
- Task and time management
- Contact companies and research participants for cooperation
- Gather data through research: Data-collection, -comparison and -filtering
- Qualitative research conduction and analysis
- Working in an international and intercultural environment
profile_positions.title: Project and Problem-based Learning Student

profile_positions.description:
A Buddy is a current AAU student who, on a voluntary basis, functions as a contact person for a group of international students and helps out during their entire exchange at Aalborg University. The Buddy assists the international students with practical matters, offers to help, answer questions and doubt and informs of life in Aalborg and Denmark.

Buddy:
- Planning and implementing social events such as potluck dinners, Christmas parties, Easter dinners, summer parties, Halloween parties etc.
- Planning and implementing tours around Denmark to tourist sites such as Skagen, Aarhus, Odense, Copenhagen etc.
- Assisting with practical matters (moving to Denmark, rules and regulations, housing, studies etc.)
profile_positions.title: Buddy (International Department)

profile_positions.description:
Abbey Ireland is an international privately owned Irish tour operator company that creates and sells tours in Ireland in cooperation with suppliers to clients around the world. As a tour operator, Abbey Tours provides services within group and individual travel, however, also within conference locations and travel events throughout Ireland (and Scotland) by working closely with the travel trade and event organisers of the company and its clients. This has made Abbey Tours leading within their field of expertise – travel and tourism in Ireland (and Scotland).

Executive, Admin and Operations:
- Supplier and clientele handeling and maintaining
- Supplier- and clientele correspondance, service and support
- Operating of phone and e-mail
- Planning and implementing of services for our groups: Bookings, cancellations and amendments 
  of services incl. con-celebrated masses				
- Creating and updating of travel itineraries
- Create and maintain active files
- Working organised and structured with attention to detail
- Sending out final documents to suppliers and clients
- Confirmation of transportation for our groups
- Various administrative tasks in our IT system, TourPlan
- Run service reports via Excel files
- Training of new interns
- Reception cover: Operating phone and email, receive guests, arrange and manage meetings, order office supplies and take care of the post and courier

- Program: TourPlan, Microsoft Office and Outlook.

Internship placement project:
In cooperation with the Chairman and HR Director of Abbey Tours. 
- Title: Intercultural Communication at the Workplace: A case study on Abbey Tours and its internal communication. Grade: 12 (on the Danish scale, equivalent to A on the American scale)
profile_positions.title: Admin and Operations (internship)

volunteer_experiences.description:
During my Bachelors, I volunteered as a Buddy. A Buddy is a current AAU student who, on a voluntary basis, functions as the contact person for a group of international students and helps out during their entire exchange at Aalborg University. The Buddy assists the international students with practical matters in moving and settling in a new country, answers questions around integration and the Danish culture and helps them integrate into a new life at AAU.

Buddy:
- Planning and implementing social events such as potluck dinners, Christmas parties, Easter dinners, summer parties, Halloween parties etc.
- Planning and implementing tours around Denmark to tourist sites such as Skagen, Aarhus, Odense, Copenhagen etc.
- Assisting with practical matters (moving to Denmark, rules and regulations, housing, studies etc.)
